intro: Marasmodes beyersiana, commonly known as the Beyer's krag, is a rare and striking plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Proteaceae family, which includes many ornamental and ecologically significant species. The plant is characterized by its long, narrow leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
